title: "Congratulations, ma'am, it's a healthy darkin/boy!"
body:
Lore fiends assemble! Scurry out of your speculation caves and gaze upon this new wonder!
The flavor of the year is Ionia, and after a colorful entree comes a sweet and sour main dish:
A shirtless, colored hair streak, I-am-the-protagonists-best-friend-who-goes-evil type of fella with darkin for a roomate (Aatrox lost his snowflake status).
He's also Zed's workplace partner/grasshopper in learning/boy to crack cold ones with.
Don't forget Ionia now oficially has two bioligical-weapon-thingamajiggers (let's see if Varus gets some love now, maybe even a darkin connection).
Now comes the time to lie down and sway sideways with our thumbs in our mouths as we wait for the paragraph of text that will shape darkin history for the first time in years!

PS: I kinda hoped for a frozen watcher after the teaser, but this will do just fine. Asked for the burger, they brought me the ribs, so I ain't even mad.
https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/story-art/HFwv5eW4-new-champion-guess

replies.body: I'd avoid smacking him on the arse. Things could get... slicey.

That's very kind of you to say. 

I'm sorry, it's honestly just a case of I've been changing a bunch of stuff in what I'm doing behind the scenes here (all for the better), and being a better father and husband by being less crazy with my time (No Scott, you won't go on the boards at 2am, bad Scott!) so I've been a bit sidetracked.

Essentially every now and again I'll take on a project that I think is important and it swallows up my time and focus.

Saying that, I'll try to pop on here and there and gabber a bit more.

I think it would be better if you did some question on Ask Riot instead a few times a year! Some lore-related Ask Riots in the past have been a bit trolly and disappointing, but if you could manage more serious Runeterra-related answers on there occasionally that'd be awesome! :)
Not to mention the fact that a baby that can slip away through walls would be a terrifying concept...

Well, there goes my sleep for a week.

this makes me think of Trainspotting.

So, am I too assume that the Darkin were so powerful in the past that an Ancient Race had the means to lock their forms/powers into weapons so they wouldn't cause the destruction of Runeterra itself. In which they locked up said weapons in vaults scattered around the world where they were lost to time, becoming myths and stories told around camp fires. With only a select few surviving over the past thousands of years to dug up by unsuspecting grave robbers and/or explorers in which they become so corrupted that the Darkin was able to take over as the host of the body. 
Or am I just taking a wild guess?

You had a great theory with the Watcher. 
It's speculations like yours which add another level of enjoyability to this game and it's universe. Always feels great when you nail it too : P.
You also have a fantastic post here as well. 

PS: I also like Ribs.

Thanks!
Yeah, when they said it would be more of a jungler it threw me off and I realized it probably wouldn't be. 
Though I have no idea what class a watcher would be. 
A mage maybe?

The fact that he gathers souls,sounds to me like Zeds shadow techniques are literally based on killing people to gain their strenght.
I mean Xayah fought a shadow user who infused his blade with the strenght of the fallen and Zed himself got an ingame ability that allows him to steal AD from his victims.
That would explain why the shadow techniques were considered evil by Kusho,since they encourage the user to kill others.
